meanings.sent1: The snell knife easily cut through the paper.
meanings.sent2: Her snell eyes spotted the tiny bird in the tree.
meanings.sent3: The snell cat pounced on the toy mouse with precision.
meanings.sent4: His snell mind quickly solved the puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The snell wind carried the scent of flowers to her nose.

meanings.sent1: He used a rope to snell the boat to the dock.
meanings.sent2: She snelled the tent stakes firmly into the ground.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to snell the acorn in place but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: The farmer snelled the gate shut to keep the animals in.
meanings.sent5: The chef snelled the lid onto the pot to keep the soup hot.

meanings.definition: (noun) A leader attached to a fishing line
meanings.sent1: The fisherman tied the snell to the fishing hook.
meanings.sent2: She carefully attached the snell to the fishing line.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull stole the shiny snell from the tackle box.
meanings.sent4: The snell guided the hook to where the fish were biting.
meanings.sent5: He replaced the old snell with a new one for better fishing luck.
